conversation.content: Let me see here... Order cancelled. Three weeks ago. Still no refund.
Oh gosh. Three weeks? That's—*exhales* I'm so sorry. Let me pull this up right away... What's the order number?
ORD dash—wait, sorry—eight seven two. Nine. XM.
Got it. ORD-8729-XM... *sharp inhale* Oh. I see what happened here. The refund, er, it got stuck in our payment processing system on November 2nd. That must be so frustrating...
Hmm, stuck. Of course. What if—no. Just tell me when.
Right. So. The good news—I mean, I can manually push this through. Takes about, um, 3-5 business days normally. But for you? Let me expedite...
Manually. Three to five days. For my own money. Fascinating.
I know. I know, it's—*exhales* Look. What I'm doing right now. Case number CSE-4412-B. Priority escalation. Should hit your account in, errr, 24 hours max.
Twenty four hours. Okay so that means... tomorrow afternoon then?
Tomorrow by 3PM Eastern. Absolutely. And I'm—wait no, let me also... adding a $15 credit. For the hassle.
Wait. You're actually—fifteen dollar credit? That's... unexpectedly decent of you.
*soft exhale* Listen. Three weeks is inexcusable. The original amount, $287.43, plus that credit. All hitting your card ending in 4782 tomorrow.
Let me think... yeah, 4782, that's the right card. Thank you. Genuinely.
Of course! And, uh, here's my direct extension. 5509. If it doesn't show by 3PM tomorrow...
Five five zero nine. Got it. You've been—I mean, you actually helped.
That's what I'm—I mean, I get it. Money stuck in limbo is... *trails off* Anyway. Is there anything else?
Hmm, what if this happens again? With future orders?
So! Good question. I'm flagging your account—code RFP-PRIORITY. Basically ensures faster processing. Any future refunds? 48 hours maximum. No more waiting.
RFP priority. Okay so that's... permanent? On my account? That's incredibly helpful, actually.
Permanent. Yes. And, erhm, I put detailed notes. Transaction ID TXN-9982-QV7 has everything documented. Next agent sees this? They'll know exactly what happened.

scenario: trying to recover funds from a cancelled order
